Posts.Content: Have a question fellas. I had my catheter removed on Friday and all seemed good til today. I noticed that I have some minor burning and a little blood in my urine. I know that I have clearly not drank enough water the past 2 days, and was wondering if this is normal?
Posts.Signature: 48 y/o @ diagnosis Psa was 4.2 10 months before diagnosis Psa rechecked and showed 6.6 8 months after first Psa Doc didn't tell me what I could not do prior to Psa test, so Uro did another one week later. Psa was 4.71 No family history of PC Had minor urinary issues prior to diagnosis. Normal DRE Biopsy ordered, left side of gland clear. Right side had 5 of 6 cores positive. All 5 cores were 3+3 Gleason 6 supposedly. Prostate said to be 20 grams (small). Doc ordered Genomic test. Will return May 9th for plan of action.
Posts.Title: Burning and Small amount of blood in urine

Posts.Content: 10-4, thank you! I started drinking a ton of H20 and now I have not seen any blood and the burning is clearing up. Heading to the gym!

Posts.Title: Burning and Small amount of blood in urine

Posts.Content: Ok guys, well I got my path report today. Mostly good news, only bad part was a small positive margin at bladder neck and apex. Doc said he felt that it was from surgery and not actually an issue that he was concerned with. Gleason score remained a 6 throughout the entire prostate, with no upgrading at all. Seminal vesicles, lymph nodes negative and no EPE. Very minimal EPI deep in gland, and no lymph vascular invasion. Doc said there is a chance that radiation could come later,but only if PSA rises,which he predicts will not. All in all, I will take it! Not that I had a choice,but after reading many others stories, I should consider myself fortunate. God bless!

Posts.Title: Post Pathology Report

Posts.Content: First, and foremost, I want to thank all of you guys for your response to my first post. I appreciate tje n info. and positivity. However, after reading and researching so many aspects of this disease, I am getting less optimistic. Initially, I thought that my young age, suggeted gleason 6 report and low psa of 4.71 was a good sign. But after really reading up on things, my age, size of my prostate (20 grams), high core count (5 of 6 on right lobe), seem to be painting a different more bleak prognosis as it currently stands. The doctor never mentioned any of that. I have also found throughout my reafings that young men with large volume, despite lower initial grades do not fair as well as thought, due to increasing high accounts of non confinement. Thoughts?
Posts.Title: don't know what to believe

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, it's been awhile since I posted. Just wanted everyone to know that my 11 month test came back as usual at less than 0.04. I am grateful because just last night my buddy and PC warrior has had a recurrence after 3 years and it's vicious. His PSA skyrocketed from 1.84 in late December to over 60 in April. He has had surgery, radiation and 18 months of HT. He is only 53.....He was told he had Gleason 6, prior to surgery, and found put it was 10 afterwards. It had grown outside and into his seminal vesicles. Please pray for him as he is going back on HT and having at least one lymph node removed/radiated.

Posts.Title: 3 month post PSA test

Posts.Content: I met up with a close friend the other day that I had no idea had PC. At age 47, back in 1999, he was diagnosed. All he could tell me about the diagnosis was that 4 of 10 cores were positive and it appeared contained. Anyhow, he had open RP, as robotic was not an option. Afterwards, he had a year and a half of undetectable readings. Then a rise started. 37 radiation treatments followed. Back to zero for another year and a half. Then the rise again started and has done so for the past 15 years! The weird part is that it goes up and down and up and down. It's been as high as 8.9 and back down to 5 and so on and so on. He has had no othet treatments in the 18 years since diagnosis and the Doc says that until it gets to 10, if ever, they aren't doing anything. Can anybody explain to me what the hell is going on with this situation lol? I couldn't hardly believe the story, and it makes no sense to me at all. Thanks!
Posts.Signature: 48 y/o @ diagnosis Psa was 4.2 10 months before diagnosis Psa rechecked and showed 6.6 8 months after first Psa Doc didn't tell me what I could not do prior to Psa test, so Uro did another one week later. Posts.Title: Question for the smart guys

Posts.Content: No Mike, he has had zero testing or further treatment. His Doc said that the fact that it has been going up and down for 15 years is the reason he has done nothing further, and won't until the PSA gets to 10. He has no symptoms of metastatic spread and just keeps plugging along. Super strange.

Posts.Title: Question for the smart guys

Posts.Content: Sorry upfront gents, but I have yet to update my sig. Just to update some things, my cancer post pathology was all confirmed to be Gleason 6, however the biopsy did miss a tumor on the left side. With that said, the pathology also showed 2 small positive margins, Apex and Base and what was described as some microscopic cells at the bladder neck, which all sucks. However after a long talk with my surgeon, he explained that my prostate actually came out in two pieces (tore), and that he had to sew it all back together to give to pathology. The positive margins and bladder neck cells reported in his opinion were most likely just the result of the pathologist doing the best observation he could do with a distorted prostate, sewn back together and that the margins along with the bladder neck were never positive at all. He felt quite confident that he "got it all". I guess time will tell, as I have heard mention that Gleason 6 cells cant live outside the prostate, but I am really unsure that science can actually prove that hypothesis.

Posts.Title: PSA results

Posts.Content: Well, I haven't posted in a bit because of life getting in the way, but I just got my 6 months PSA results. Both my 8 week and 12 week test was less than 0.04. This time it was less than 0.07. Kinda scared me, but the docs office said there is nothing to be worried about and this is seen often with the ultra sensative test. Still worries me a bit, but my testosterone was 530! A little bummed out about that too, seeing as how it was 706 last April, but oh well. Anyhow, another firing squad reprieve for another 3 months, I guess.

Posts.Title: PSA results

Posts.Content: Well, not to beat up on my Doc too bad, but he did tell me about two of the three margins and final Gleason score of 6. However, he did not mention that my prostate was actually torn bad, potentially causing the margins after it was sewed back together and given to the path lab. Also, while going over the report did not mention that the pathologist upgraded me to stage 3 because of the margin he told me about at the bladder neck. Again, something he was sure he may have caused, not on purpose with the removal. He said that he incinerated the entire area anyhow. He is a very accomplished surgeon that I researched heavily prior to letting him cut on me, and I told him that. In only a way that a confident surgeon could say it, he said his only concerns with my case was the final gleason score, and negative seminal vesicle, lymph vascular and lymph node invasion. He maintained that pathology reports are difficult to analyze, especially in my case, and are often misleading in regards to margins. He said the true tale of the tape that will never lie going forward is the PSA reading, which is undetectable and should remain that way. If it trends upward in the future, he said we would radiate the area and be done with it. He is a very optimistic and slightly arrogant guy. I kinda like that.

Posts.Title: First post-op PSA

Posts.Content: At just 8 weeks post op, I came back less than 0.04! Thank you Jesus! Also, Doc went into a great more bit of detail about my pathbreport, and kinda climbed up my ass a bit lol. Said my prostate came out in 2 pieces during surgery and that all of my margins are probably false, especially given my undetectable PSA prior to the 3 month standard. He is a super confident surgeon, but I did tell him two things : 1) He needs to explain shit better, especially to a COP. 2) I asked him if he knew the difference between God and surgeons? He said "no". I said God doesn't think he is a surgeon! Best wishes to all you guys on this forum, your support and encouragement has been so helpful. Godspeed!

Posts.Title: Accuracy of online Calculators

Posts.Content: Well, I never thought I would hear the word cancer at 48, but I did. Only symptoms I had were very minor urinary issues. Intial psa was 6.6 at GP office. However, I was never told the not to do list prior to psa test coupled with the DRE prior to the blood draw that happened. Anyhow, went to urology doc, who retested 7 days later and psa was 4.71, still too high. 12 core showed left side clear, but 5 of 6 not clear on right. I was told that I had a gleason 3+3. However, the doc sent my tissue samples to California for genetic testing. I was told this has something to do with checking the aggressiveness of my cancer. That kind of scares me due to the fact that I guess the Gleason score can go up from there. My wife is scared to death, more so than me and despite the fact that my doctor told me this was not a death sentence, she feels that the results are going to come back worse than Gleason 6 and that I'm going to die from this disease. Well, I guess I'm in the club
Posts.Title: 48 y/o Newbie

Posts.Content: Thank everyone for the positive comments! It truly has helped with our stress and anxiety of the entire situation. I am so glad I found this forum. By the way I was asked where I am from. Well, Illinois, just outside of St. Louis Missouri. I look forward to hearing from more of you guys! Gary.

Posts.Title: 48 y/o Newbie

Posts.Content: Hello all, I am quickly approaching my surgery date of June 14th. I am looking forward to having surgery, as much as can be expected. However, the main thought and apprehension with me is the post pathology report, as it certainly could lend to additional treatment as well as the probability of the cancer returning. Although my Gleason grades are said to be 3+3's, I do have 5 cores positive on one side of my prostate, which clearly is alot. With that said, how many of you guys have had say positive margins or ECP post surgery and how accurate are the risk calculators actually? Thanks!

Posts.Title: I have a question

Posts.Content: I am sure that this has been addressed many times, but I am going to ask again. Once you have a RALP and if your PSA starts to rise I know that adjuvant radiation to the prostate bed is next. However, after that say you start seeing yet another increase in your PSA, then what? I know that the dreaded HT is apparently the next weapon, but how does that actually work? What I am trying to say, is are you on that crap for the rest of your life or just until you become resistant and then overall screwed? Thanks!

Posts.Title: I have a question

Posts.Content: I was having a discussion with a guy the other day and the topic of recurrence, either local or systemic came up. While talking about it, we pondered about why our immune systems would not kill any cancer cells "floating" around or left behind after tumor removal. The immune systems did this policing thousands of times a day before our cancer diagnosis. Any ideas why that would not continue to occur once the tumors have effectively been removed, leaving behind only small amounts of cancer cells?
Posts.Signature: 48 y/o @ diagnosis Psa was 4.2 10 months before diagnosis Psa rechecked and showed 6.6 8 months after first Psa Doc didn't tell me what I could not do prior to Psa test, so Uro did another one week later. Posts.Title: Question about recurrence post RP

Posts.Content: Hello all, well I had an 8 week post surgery meeting and blood draw today. Wife and I met with surgeon and went over path report in detail etc. Well, all the cancer was in fact gleason 6, but was found on both sides, not just the right as the biopsy showed. Also, I thought the report was actually not as specific as some I have heard about. Anyhow, no lymph vascular invasion, no seminal vesicle invasion or lymph node invasion. However, small margins at apex, left base and bladder neck. Doc explained that the bladder neck and base were essentially the same and he felt the complete burning of that area destroyed anything there. As far as the other margin, he says during surgery those can appear positive but may not be. My path report shows me as a pt3a, which I didn't like.the sound of, but because of the microscopic bladder neck cells, it is what it is. He said there was bo extraprostatic extension however. My surgeon was quite honestly pretty excited about the outcome, me.....not sure yet. He was more excited about the gleason grade than anything. I said well thats great as long as we did get ALL of it and if not, it didn't decide to mutate into gleason 7,8,9 or 10 and metastasize. He also felt if we even had the future need, radiation would kill anything left behind. Hope he is right!
Posts.Signature: 48 y/o @ diagnosis Psa was 4.2 10 months before diagnosis Psa rechecked and showed 6.6 8 months after first Psa Doc didn't tell me what I could not do prior to Psa test, so Uro did another one week later. Psa was 4.71 No family history of PC Had minor urinary issues prior to diagnosis. Normal DRE Biopsy ordered, left side of gland clear. Right side had 5 of 6 cores positive. All 5 cores were 3+3 Gleason 6 supposedly. Prostate said to be 20 grams (small). Doc ordered Genomic test. Will return May 9th for plan of action.
Posts.Title: Latest news from 8 week post op visit

Posts.Content: Thanks guys for all the advice and discussion. I have a top Cardiologist in St. Louis and will know my plans this Tuesday. I will post more soon.
Posts.Signature: 48 y/o @ diagnosis Psa was 4.2 10 months before diagnosis Psa rechecked and showed 6.6 8 months after first Psa Doc didn't tell me what I could not do prior to Psa test, so Uro did another one week later. Psa was 4.71 No family history of PC Had minor urinary issues prior to diagnosis. Normal DRE Biopsy ordered, left side of gland clear. Right side had 5 of 6 cores positive. All 5 cores were 3+3 Gleason 6 supposedly. Prostate said to be 20 grams (small). Doc ordered Genomic test. Will return May 9th for plan of action.
Posts.Title: 2017 has been worst year ever!

Posts.Content: Welp, on top of my cancer diagnosis, they found a left bundle branch block in my heart I didn't know I had during surgery. Follow up confirm dialated cardiomyopathy! Awesome! For a 48 year old gym rat with a strict diet for I dunno, forever, I can hardly believe this shit. Well, at 8% body fat, at least I will look good in my casket! I just have to remember that God isnt giving me more than I can handle. Also, on a sidenote, I probably did all this shit to myself as a recovering alcoholic. Just sayin, kinda the "wreckage of my past".
